importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication reflects the ongoing narrative of NFL Week 7 in the 2025 season, highlighting dramatic comebacks and quarterback performance shifts that define the current season's volatility.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The first seven weeks of the 2025 NFL season are being analyzed for statistical anomalies such as late-game lead changes, indicating a season defined by unpredictability and resilience in team performance.

keyTakeAways: The NFL season has seen unprecedented lead changes in the final two minutes of regulation, with 26 such instances through Week 7 — the most in history over that span.

The Denver Broncos made history by overcoming a 19-point deficit in the fourth quarter against the New York Giants, becoming the first team in NFL history to do so after leading by 18 points or more after three quarters.
Second-year quarterback Bo Nix led a dramatic comeback for Denver, throwing two touchdowns and rushing for two, including a game-winning field goal as time expired.

Drake Maye broke Tom Brady’s Patriots franchise record with a 91.3% completion rate in a 31-13 win over the Tennessee Titans, becoming the first player in Super Bowl era to complete 90% of passes, throw over 200 yards, and rush over 50 yards in a single game.

Quarterback Justin Fields was benched at halftime during the Jets' loss to the Panthers due to poor first-half performance, while Tua Tagovailoa was benched in the fourth quarter after a three-interception game against the Dolphins.
The Miami Dolphins and New York Jets fell to 1-13 and 0-7 respectively after losses, with both teams experiencing significant quarterback changes and defensive struggles.

The Green Bay Packers' victory over the Arizona Cardinals was fueled by defensive dominance, particularly from Micah Parsons, who recorded his third sack of the game and was instrumental in forcing a late turnover.
Drake Maye's performance marks a potential turning point for the New England Patriots, who are now seeking a new quarterback identity following Tom Brady's departure.

The article underscores how quarterback performance and benching decisions directly influence team outcomes, reflecting broader themes of team stability, adaptability, and performance pressure in professional sports.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Week 7 of the 2025 NFL season featured dramatic comebacks, record-breaking performances, and high-profile quarterback benchings. The Denver Broncos made history by overcoming a 19-point deficit against the New York Giants, becoming the first team to do so after leading by 18 points in the first three quarters. Second-year QB Bo Nix led a pivotal fourth-quarter surge, including a game-winning field goal. Meanwhile, Drake Maye broke Tom Brady’s Patriots franchise record with a 91.3% completion rate in a 31-13 win over the Titans, becoming the first player in Super Bowl era history to complete 90% of passes, throw over 200 yards, and rush over 50 yards in a single game. On the other side, the Miami Dolphins and New York Jets suffered crushing losses, with Tua Tagovailoa and Justin Fields both benched due to poor performances, underscoring the volatility of quarterback decisions and team stability. The article highlights the growing unpredictability in NFL outcomes, emphasizing resilience, performance pressure, and the critical role of quarterback performance in determining game results.
title: Historic and dramatic comebacks, second-year QB breaks Tom Brady record and high-profile benchings: NFL Week 7 Sunday review
